verses.roman:
taṁ duratyaya-vikrāntam
ādāya pramadottamā
harer aṁśāṁśa-sambhūtaṁ
bhartur antikam āgamat

synonyms: tam—him; duratyaya-vikrāntam—whose strength was insurmountable; ādāya—taking with her; pramadā-uttamā—the best of women, Śakuntalā; hareḥ—of God; aṁśa-aṁśa-sambhūtam—a partial plenary incarnation; bhartuḥ antikam—unto her husband; āgamat—approached.
translation: Śakuntalā, the best of beautiful women, along with her son, whose strength was insurmountable and who was a partial expansion of the Supreme Godhead, approached her husband, Duṣmanta.
